description: Add Only Flag.  Indicates that the service is an add only, not an update.

Receivable_Writeoff_ReasonObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Receivable_Writeoff_ReasonObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Receivable_Writeoff_ReasonObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Reference to an existing Receivable Writeoff Category for update only purposes

Receivable_Writeoff_Reason_Data.description: Receivable Writeoff Category Reference ID.  This is the Receivable Writeoff Category unique identifier
Free form text field for the Receivable Writeoff Category Name

validation.validation: Enter a unique Writeoff Category Name. [name] is already in use.

Receivable_Writeoff_Reason_UsageObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Receivable_Writeoff_Reason_UsageObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Receivable_Writeoff_Reason_UsageObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Receivable_Writeoff_Reason_Data.description: The functional area that can use the writeoff reason. You must specify a value. Possible value is Customer Accounts, or Student Financials.
